thread.title: HTC U Ultra and U Play launched in India for Rs 59,990 and Rs 39,990 respectively
thread.title_full: HTC U Ultra and U Play launched in India for Rs 59,990 and Rs 39,990 respectively

title: HTC U Ultra and U Play launched in India for Rs 59,990 and Rs 39,990 respectively
text:
HTC U Ultra and U Play launched in India for Rs 59,990... HTC U Ultra and U Play launched in India for Rs 59,990 and Rs 39,990 respectively By - February 21, 2017 “The U Ultra is the brand’s first smartphone to sport a secondary ticker display on top of the main screen” 
HTC introduced its latest smartphones dubbed the U Ultra and U Play in January with a new all-glass design. Today at an event, the company has launched the new U series phones in India. The U Ultra is the brand’s first smartphone to boast a secondary ticker screen above the main display. The U series phones are equipped with HTC’s Sense Companion, which is powered by AI to learn a user’s daily activity and adapt accordingly. 
The HTC U Ultra and U Play get fingerprint sensors, which are integrated into their home buttons. They sport biometric voice unlock and control features, four low-powered always-on microphones that respond to voice commands, U-Sonic sonar-based technology and skip the 3.5mm audio jack in favour of USB Type-C audio. 
The HTC U Ultra flagship flaunts a 5.7-inch QHD display with Gorilla Glass 5 on top. The 2-inch always-on secondary screen above the main display gives you access to frequently-used apps, reminders and more. The phone utilises a 2.15GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 821 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. The phone comes with 64GB of expandable storage, Android Nougat, 4G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2, NFC and a 3,000mAh battery with fast charging support. The camera department includes a 12MP UltraPixel 2 rear snapper with OIS, PDAF, laser autofocus, dual-tone LED flash and 4K recording, and a 16MP selfie shooter with an UltraPixel mode. 
The HTC U Play sports a smaller 5.2-inch Super LCD full HD display with Gorilla Glass on top. It is packed with a MediaTek Helio P10 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 64GB, further expandable up to 2TB. The phone features a 16MP OIS rear camera with PDAF and a dual-tone LED flash, and a 16MP selfie shooter with an UltraPixel mode and FHD recording. It comes with 4G LTE, NFC, Android Marshmallow and a 2,500mAh battery. 
The HTC U Ultra has been priced at Rs 59,990, while the U Play will set you back by Rs 39,990. They will go on sale in the country by mid-March. Facebook Comments
